translation: ...[...,;Consecration Sutra Vol. 12]

source_sentence: 藥師如來本願功德經序
translation: Preface to the Sutra on the Merit of the Former Vows of the Medicine Tathāgata

source_sentence: 藥師如來本願經者，致福消災之要法也；曼殊以慈悲之力請說尊號，如來以利物之心盛陳功業；十二大願彰因行之弘遠，七寶莊嚴顯果德之純淨；憶念稱名則眾苦咸脫，祈請供養則諸願皆滿；至於病士求救應死更生，王者攘災轉禍為福；信是消百怪之神符，除九橫之妙術矣。
translation: The Original Vows of the Medicine Tathāgata is an important teaching for bringing about good fortune and eliminating disasters; Mañjuśrī invokes the name of the Tathāgata with the power of compassion, and the Tathāgata presents his merits with the intention of benefiting all living things; the twelve great vows highlight the breadth of the causal practices, and the seven precious adornments reveal the purity of the fruition; recollection and invocation of the name brings freedom from all suffering, and invocation and offerings bring fulfillment to all vows; as for the sick man seeking help, he is revived in response to death, and the king who hastens out of calamity to turn misfortune into fortune; it is believed to be a miraculous talisman for eliminating a hundred strange things and a marvelous technique for removing nine irregularities.

source_sentence: 昔宋孝武之世，鹿野寺沙門慧簡已曾譯出在世流行，但以梵宋不融、文辭雜糅，致令轉讀之輩多生疑惑。
translation: In the old Song Dynasty, during the reign of Xiao Wu, the monk Luye Temple, Hui Jian, had already translated it for world-wide consumption, but because of the lack of integration between Sanskrit and Song, the text and language were mixed, causing many doubts among those who read it.

source_sentence: 矩早學梵書恒披葉典，思遇此經驗其紕謬；開皇十七年初獲一本，猶恐脫誤未敢即翻，至大業十一年復得二本，更相讎比方為揩定，遂與三藏法師達磨笈多，并大隋翻經沙門法行明則、長順海馭等，於東都洛水南上林園翻經舘重譯此本。
translation: When he first received a copy in the 17th year of the Kaihuang reign, he was still afraid of losing it and did not dare to translate it. In the 11th year of the Daoyeung reign, he received two more copies and compared them to each other in order to confirm them.

source_sentence: 深鑑前非方懲後失，故一言出口必三覆乃書，傳度幽旨差無大過；其年十二月八日翻勘方了，仍為一卷。
translation: He was deeply concerned about the faults of the former and corrected the faults of the latter, so he had to repeat his words three times before he wrote them, transmitting the hidden meaning of the scriptures without any major errors; on the eighth day of the twelfth month of that year, he had it reviewed and confirmed, and it remained in one volume.

source_sentence: 所願此經深義人人共解，彼佛名號處處遍聞，十二夜叉念佛恩而護國，七千眷屬承經力以利民，帝祚遐永，群生安樂，式貽來世序云爾。
translation: It was hoped that the profound meaning of this sūtra would be understood by everyone, that the Buddha's name would be heard everywhere, that the twelve yakṣas would be mindful of the Buddha's kindness and protect the country, that the seven thousand retinues would inherit the power of the sūtra for the benefit of the people, that the emperor's fortunes would be prolonged, that all sentient beings would be comfortable, and that the sequence of future generations would be in accordance with the style of the yakṣa.

source_sentence: 佛說藥師如來本願經
translation: Foshuo yakṣa rulai benyuan jing

source_sentence: 新翻藥師經，大業十二年十二月八日，沙門慧矩等六人，於東都洛水南上林園譯出。
translation: This new translation of the Yakushi Sutra was produced on the eighth day of the twelfth month of the twelfth year of the Great Work by six persons, including the ascetic Huiku, at the Shanglin Park in the south of Luoshui in the eastern capital.

source_sentence: 此本最定，諸讀誦者願莫更疑，得罪不輕。
translation: This is the most definitive translation, so please don't doubt it any more than you do, for it would be a great offense.

source_sentence: 佛說藥師如來本願經
translation: Sutra of the Original Vows of the Medicine Tathāgata, Expounded by the Buddha

source_sentence: 隋天竺三藏達摩笈多譯
translation: Sui Translation of the Tianzang Tripiṭaka Dharmagupta

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時婆伽婆遊行人間至毘舍離國住樂音樹下，與大比丘眾八千人俱、菩薩三萬六千、國王、大臣、婆羅門、居士、天龍、阿修羅、揵達婆、伽樓茶、緊那羅、摩呼羅伽等，大眾圍遶於前說法。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, a great multitude of Bhagavān traveled among the people to the country of Vaiśālī and stayed under the music tree, accompanied by a great assembly of 8,000 monks, 36,000 bodhisattvas, kings, ministers, brāhmaṇas, householders, celestials, dragons, asuras, gandharvas, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, and others, and the whole assembly surrounded him and taught the Dharma.

source_sentence: 爾時，曼殊室利法王子，承佛威神，即從座起，偏露一髆，右膝著地，向婆伽婆合掌曲躬白言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the Dharma Prince Mañjuśrī, in recognition of the Buddha's authoritative power, rose from his seat, bared one shoulder blade, knelt on his right knee, bowed with his palms together to Bhagavān, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 唯願演說諸佛名號及本昔所發殊勝大願，令眾生聞已，業障消除，攝受來世正法壞時諸眾生故。」
translation: Please explain the names of the buddhas and the special vows made in the past so that when sentient beings hear them, their karmic hindrances will be removed and they'll be able to take in sentient beings in the future when the true Dharma breaks down."

source_sentence: 爾時，婆伽婆讚曼殊室利童子言：「善哉！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān praised the boy Mañjuśrī, saying, "Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 曼殊室利大慈悲者，起無量悲，勸請我說，為欲義利種種業障所纏眾生，饒益安樂諸天人故。
translation: "Mañjuśrī, the greatly compassionate one, arouses measureless compassion and encourages me to teach it for the sake of the welfare of sentient beings tethered by various karmic hindrances and for the benefit and happiness of gods and humans.

source_sentence: 曼殊室利！
translation: Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 當善憶念，聽我所說。」
translation: Remember well, and listen to what I've taught you."

source_sentence: 時曼殊室利童子樂聽佛說，白言：「唯然，世尊！」
translation: The boy Mañjuśrī then listened happily to the Buddha's teaching and said, "Yes, Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛告曼殊室利：「東方過此佛土十恒河沙等佛土之外，有世界名淨琉璃，彼土有佛，名藥師琉璃光如來、應、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊。
translation: The Buddha told Mañjuśrī, "In the east, beyond the ten Gaṅgāsas of Buddha-lands in this Buddha-land, there's a world called Pure Lapis Lazuli, and in that land there's a Buddha named Yakushi Lapis Lazuli Tathāgata, Worthy, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfectly Virtuous, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Tamer of Beings, Teacher of Gods and People, Buddha, and World Honored One.

source_sentence: 「曼殊室利！
translation: "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來本行菩薩行時，發十二大願。
translation: When the Bhagavān, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata, started this bodhisattva practice, he made twelve great vows.

source_sentence: 何者十二？
translation: What are the twelve?

source_sentence: 「第一大願：願我來世於佛菩提得正覺時，自身光明熾然，照曜無量無數無邊世界，三十二丈夫大相及八十小好以為莊嚴；我身既爾，令一切眾生如我無異。
translation: "First great vow: May I hope that when I attain perfect enlightenment in the next life, my own light will be so blazing that it will shine brightly on measureless, innumerable, and limitless worlds, adorned by the great features of my thirty-two great sons and eighty minor features; once I am in this body, I will cause all sentient beings to be like me without distinction.

source_sentence: 「第二大願：願我來世得菩提時，身如琉璃，內外清淨，無復瑕垢，光明曠大，威德熾然，身善安住，焰網莊嚴，過於日月，若有眾生，生世界之間，或復人中昏暗及夜，莫知方所，以我光故，隨意所趣，作諸事業。
translation: "Second great vow: May I hope that when I attain enlightenment in the next life, my body will be like beryl, pure inside and out, spotless, with a vast radiance and blazing virtue, well-anchored in body, and adorned by a flaming web that surpasses the sun and moon, and that if sentient beings are born between worlds or among humans in the dark or at night, and I don't know where I am, I'll perform tasks according to their destinies because of my light.

source_sentence: 「第三大願：願我來世得菩提時，以無邊無限智慧方便，令無量眾生界受用無盡，莫令一人有所少乏。
translation: "Third great vow: May I hope that when I attain enlightenment in the next life, I'll use infinite wisdom and skillful means to cause measureless sentient beings in the world to experience inexhaustible benefit, so that no one will be deprived of anything.

source_sentence: 「第四大願：願我來世得菩提時，諸有眾生行異道者，一切安立菩提道中，行聲聞道、行辟支佛道者，皆以大乘而安立之。
translation: "Fourth great vow: May I hope that when I attain enlightenment in the next world, all sentient beings who practice a different path will be placed in the path of enlightenment, and those who practice the path of the śrāvakas and those who practice the path of the solitary realizers will be placed in the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 「第五大願：願我來世得菩提時，若有眾生於我法中修行梵行，此諸眾生無量無邊，一切皆得不缺減戒，具三聚戒，無有破戒趣惡道者。
translation: "Fifth great vow: May I wish that when I attain enlightenment in the next life, if sentient beings cultivate the religious practice in my teaching, that these sentient beings, without measure or limit, will all attain the precepts without loss and will be endowed with the three grades of morality, and that there will be no one who breaks the precepts and goes into a bad path.

source_sentence: 「第六大願：願我來世得菩提時，若有眾生，其身下劣，諸根不具，醜陋頑愚，聾盲跛躄，身攣背傴，白癩癲狂，若復有餘種種身病，聞我名已，一切皆得，諸根具足，身分成滿。
translation: "Sixth great vow: May I wish that when I attain enlightenment in the next life, if there are sentient beings whose bodies are inferior, whose faculties are not fully present, who are ugly and stubborn, who are deaf and blind and lame, whose bodies are cramped and backed, who are leprosy and crazy, or who have various other physical ailments, that they all attain, after hearing my name, the fulfillment of their faculties, and the completion of their status.

source_sentence: 「第七大願：願我來世得菩提時，若有眾生，諸患逼切，無護無依，無有住處，遠離一切資生醫藥，又無親屬，貧窮可愍，此人若得聞我名號，眾患悉除，無諸痛惱，乃至究竟無上菩提。
translation: "The seventh great vow: May I attain enlightenment in the next life, if there's a sentient being who's beset by many hardships, has no protection or support, has no place to live, is removed from all necessities and medicines, has no relatives, and is pitiful in terms of poverty, then if that person hears my name, all their hardships will be removed, they'll have no pain, and they'll attain the ultimate unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「第八大願：願我來世得菩提時，若有女人，為婦人百惡所逼惱故，厭離女身，願捨女形，聞我名已，轉女人身成丈夫相，乃至究竟無上菩提。
translation: "Eighth great vow: May I attain enlightenment in a future life if a woman, who's been tormented by a hundred evils in a woman's body and who's disillusioned with the female form, wishes to abandon the female form and, after hearing my name, transform her woman's body into that of a husband, so that she may attain unsurpassed enlightenment in the end.

source_sentence: 「第九大願：願我來世得菩提時，令一切眾生解脫魔網，若墮種種異見稠林，悉當安立置於正見，次第示以菩薩行門。
translation: "Ninth great vow: May I cause all sentient beings to be freed from the web of Māra when I attain enlightenment in the next life, and if they fall into the thicket of various divergent views, I will establish them in right view and teach them in turn the way of the bodhisattva's practice.

source_sentence: 「第十大願：願我來世得菩提時，若有眾生，種種王法，繫縛、鞭撻、牢獄、應死，無量災難，悲憂煎迫，身心受苦，此等眾生，以我福力，皆得解脫一切苦惱。
translation: "Tenth great vow: May I wish that when I attain enlightenment in the next life, if there are sentient beings who are bound by various kingly laws, bound by whipping, imprisoned, subject to death, subject to measureless disasters, tormented by sorrow, and suffering in body and soul, that these sentient beings, because of my merits, will be freed from all suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 「十一大願：願我來世得菩提時，若有眾生，飢火燒身，為求食故，作諸惡業，我於彼所，先以最妙色香味食，飽足其身，後以法味，畢竟安樂而建立之。
translation: "Eleven great vows: May I attain enlightenment in the next life, and if there are sentient beings whose bodies are on fire from hunger and who do bad actions in search of food, I will first feed them with food of the finest color and flavor, and then I will establish their final well-being with the taste of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「十二大願：願我來世得菩提時，若有眾生，貧無衣服，寒熱蚊虻，日夜逼惱，我當施彼，隨用衣服，種種雜色，如其所好，亦以一切寶莊嚴具，花鬘、塗香、鼓樂、眾伎，隨諸眾生所須之，具皆令滿足。
translation: "Twelve great vows: May I wish that in a future life when I attain enlightenment, if there are sentient beings who are poor and have no clothing and are beset by hot and cold mosquitoes and stinging insects day and night, I'll give them clothing of whatever color they like and all the ornaments of treasure, flowers, perfumes, music, and tricks that sentient beings need, and I'll make them all meet.

source_sentence: 「此十二大願，是彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來、應、正遍知，行菩薩時，本昔所作。
translation: "These twelve great vows were made by the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Perfectly Omniscient Medicine Buddha, when he was a practicing bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 「復次，曼殊室利！
translation: "Furthermore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 藥師琉璃光如來所有諸願，及彼佛土功德莊嚴，乃至窮劫說不可盡。
translation: "The vows of the Bhaiṣajyaguru Tathāgata of Lapis Light and the attributes and splendor of that Buddha's land are inexpressible even throughout an entire eon.

source_sentence: 彼佛國土一向清淨，無女人形，離諸欲惡，亦無一切惡道苦聲，琉璃為地，城闕、垣墻、門窓、堂閣柱樑、斗拱、周匝羅網，皆七寶成，如極樂國，淨琉璃界莊嚴如是。
translation: That Buddha's land is always pure, has no female form, is free of desire and evil, and has no sound of suffering from all bad destinies. Its ground of beryl, its castle, walls, gates, halls, pillars, archways, and surrounding net are made of seven treasures like the Land of Perfect Bliss, and it's adorned like this in the pure beryl realm.

source_sentence: 「於其國中有二菩薩摩訶薩，一名日光，二名月光，於彼無量無數諸菩薩眾，最為上首，持彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來正法之藏。
translation: "In that country, there are two bodhisattvas, one named Sunlight and the other Moonlight, who are the foremost of a countless and numerous multitude of bodhisattvas and who hold the treasury of the true teaching of the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata of Lapis Light.

source_sentence: 「是故，曼殊室利！
translation: "Therefore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 信心善男子、善女人，應當願生彼佛國土。」
translation: Good men and good women of faith should wish to be born in that Buddha's land."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊復告曼殊室利童子言：「曼殊室利！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān again addressed the boy Mañjuśrī, saying, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 或有眾生，不識善惡，多貪無厭，不知布施及施果報，愚癡無智，闕於信根，聚財護惜，不欲分施。
translation: Sometimes there are sentient beings who don't know good from evil, have numerous insatiable desires, don't know the rewards of giving and generosity, are foolish and lack the faculty of faith, and gather possessions to guard and cherish, not wanting to share their gifts.

source_sentence: 此等眾生，無施心故，見乞者來，其心不喜，如割身肉。
translation: Because these sentient beings lack the mind to give, they don't rejoice when they see a beggar coming, like cutting off their own flesh.

source_sentence: 復有無量慳貪眾生，自不受用，亦不欲與父母、妻子，況奴婢、作使及餘乞人。
translation: There are also measureless stingy and greedy sentient beings who don't accept it for themselves and don't want to give it to their parents or wives, let alone to slaves, servants, messengers, or other beggars.

source_sentence: 此等眾生，人間命終，生餓鬼道，或畜生道。
translation: Such sentient beings are born in the destinies of hungry ghosts or animals when their human lives end.

source_sentence: 由昔人間，曾得聞彼藥師琉璃光如來名號故，或在鬼道，或畜生道，如來名號暫得現前，即於念時，彼處命終，還生人道，得宿命智，怖畏惡趣，不樂欲樂，好行慧施，讚歎施者，一切所有，悉能捨施，漸以頭目、手足、血肉、身分皆與求者，況餘財物。
translation: Because they had once heard the name of the Healing Tathāgata Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata among humans, they might have been in the path of ghosts or the path of animals when the Tathāgata's name was first revealed, and then, when they remembered that, at the end of their lives there, they were returned to the human path, attained knowledge of their past lives, became afraid of bad destinies, didn't enjoy desires and pleasures, gave well-wishing gifts, praised givers, and were able to relinquish everything they owned, gradually giving their heads, legs, hands, flesh, blood, and bodies to those who asked for them, not to mention other possessions.

source_sentence: 「復次，曼殊室利！
translation: "Furthermore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 有諸眾生，雖奉如來，受持學句，然破戒、破行、破於正見；或受學句，護持禁戒，然不求多聞，不解如來所說修多羅中甚深之義；或復多聞，而增上慢，自是非他，嫌謗正法，為魔伴黨。
translation: "Are there sentient beings who, though they obey the Tathāgata and uphold the teachings, nevertheless renege on the precepts, renege on their practice, and renege on right views? Or are they taught the teachings and uphold the precepts, but don't seek to learn much and don't understand the profound meaning of the sūtra as taught by the Tathāgata? Or are they well-versed, yet they become arrogant, criticize themselves and others, disparage the right teaching, and become the companions of Māra.

source_sentence: 此等癡人，及餘無量百千俱胝那由他眾生，行邪道者，當墮地獄。
translation: Such foolish people and the other sentient beings of measureless hundreds of thousands of koṭīs who follow a wrong path will fall into hell.

source_sentence: 此等眾生，應於地獄流轉無期，以得聞彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來名號故，於地獄處，彼佛威力，如來名號暫得現前，即時捨命，還生人道，正見精進，淳善淨心，便能捨家，於如來教中出家學道，漸次修行菩薩諸行。
translation: Such sentient beings should spend an indefinite amount of time in hell, but because they hear the name of the Bhagavān, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata, and because of the power of that Buddha's name, they'll be able to temporarily manifest it, immediately abandon their lives, return to the human path, correctly see and make effort, and simply cultivate a good and pure mind, then they'll be able to leave home, leave home and train on the path in the Tathāgata's teaching, and gradually cultivate the bodhisattva practices.

source_sentence: 「復次，曼殊室利！
translation: "Furthermore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 或有眾生，以妬忌故，但自稱讚，不讚他人。
translation: Sometimes there are sentient beings who, because of jealousy, only praise themselves and don't praise others.

source_sentence: 此諸眾生，以自高輕他故，於三惡道，無量千歲，受諸苦毒；過無量千歲已，於彼命終，生畜生趣，作牛馬駝驢，鞭杖捶擊，飢渴逼惱，身負重擔，隨路而行；若生人道，常居下賤，為人奴婢，受他驅役。
translation: Because they think highly of themselves and despise others, these sentient beings spend measureless thousands of years in the three evil destinies and experience pain and suffering; after those measureless thousands of years, they're born in the animal rebirth at the end of their lives, becoming oxen, horses, camels, assholes, whipped, beaten with whips, starved, thirsty, burdened, and walking along the road; if they are born in the human path, they'll always live in lowly conditions, become human slaves, and be subject to servitude.

source_sentence: 若昔人中，聞彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來名號者，以此善根，眾苦解脫，諸根猛利，聰慧博識，恒求善本，得與良友常相隨逐，能斷魔羂，破無明[穀-禾+卵]，竭煩惱河，解脫一切生老病死，憂悲苦惱。
translation: If someone from the past heard the name of the Bhagavān, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata, because of these good roots they would be freed from suffering, have sharp faculties, be intelligent and knowledgeable, always seek good roots, become constant companions and followers, be able to cut off the magical web, break through ignorance [grain - grain + egg], dry up the river of affliction, and be freed from all birth, old age, illness, death, sorrow, and distress.

source_sentence: 「復次，曼殊室利！
translation: "Furthermore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 有諸眾生，好喜乖離，更相鬪訟，此等互起惡心眾生，身口及意，恒作諸惡，為欲相損，各各常以無益相加，或告林神、樹神、山神、塚神種種別神，殺諸畜生，取其血肉，祭祀一切夜叉、羅剎食血肉者，書怨人字，并作其形，成就種種毒害、呪術、厭魅、蠱道、起屍鬼呪，欲斷彼命及壞其身。
translation: "If there are sentient beings who like to be at odds with each other and fight each other, these beings with mutually evil intentions will always do evil things with their bodies, speech, and thoughts in order to harm each other, and each will always add to the other with no benefit. They might tell a forest god, a tree god, a mountain god, or a cemetery god to variously discriminate between gods, kill animals, take their flesh and blood, sacrifice to all the yakṣas and rāṣas who eat their flesh and blood, write letters of resentment against people and make their forms, and perform various poisons, spells, spells for disgusting demons, trickery, and corpse spells in order to cut off their lives and destroy their bodies.

source_sentence: 由聞世尊藥師琉璃光如來名號故，此諸惡事不能傷損，皆得互起慈心、益心、無嫌恨心，各各歡悅，更相攝受。
translation: Because they hear the name of the Bhagavān, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata, these bad deeds cannot be harmed, and they can each be kind, beneficial, and without enmity, each rejoices, and each is further encouraged.

source_sentence: 「復次，曼殊室利！
translation: "Furthermore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 此諸四眾——比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆私——及餘信心善男子、善女人等，受八分齋，或復一年，或復三月受持諸戒，以此善根，隨所憙樂，隨所願求，若欲往生西方極樂世界阿彌陀如來所者，由得聞彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來名號故，於命終時，有八菩薩乘空而來，示其道徑，即於彼界，種種異色波頭摩華中自然化生；若復此人欲生天上，即得往生，本昔善根無有窮盡，不復更生諸餘惡趣，天上命盡，當生人間，為轉輪王，四洲自在安立，無量百千俱胝那由他眾生於十善業道，或復生於剎利大族、婆羅門大族、居士大家，金銀、粟帛、倉庫盈滿，形色具足，自在具足，眷屬具足，勇健多力如大力士；若有女人得聞說此如來名號至心受持，此人於後永離女身。」
translation: If these four groups of people - monks, nuns, laymen, laywomen - and other faithful good men and good women accept the eight-part purification, either for one year or three months, and observe the precepts, and because of these good roots they pursue their joys and desires, if they want to be reborn in the Western paradise world as the Tathāgata Amitâbha, then because they have heard the name of the Bhagavān, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata, when their lives end, eight bodhisattvas will ride up in the sky and show them the path, and they will be born spontaneously in that world amidst various different colored padauma flowers.

source_sentence: 爾時，曼殊室利童子白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the boy Mañjuśrī said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於後時，以彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來名號，於信心善男子、善女人所，種種方便流布令聞，乃至睡中亦以佛名覺寤其耳。
translation: At some point later, I'll spread the name of the Bhagavān, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata, in ways that make good men and good women of faith hear it, even to the point of awakening their ears while they're asleep with the Buddha's name.

source_sentence: 若受持此經讀誦宣說，或復為他分別開解，若自書，若令人書，若取經卷五色淨綵以盛裹之，灑掃淨處以安置之，持種種華、種種香、塗香、華鬘、寶幢、幡蓋而用供養，爾時，四大天王，與其眷屬，并餘百千俱胝那由他諸天，皆詣其所。
translation: If he were to accept this sūtra, recite it, preach it, discern and understand it for others, write it himself or have it written, or take a scroll of sūtra, wrap it in five-colored pure ribbons, sweep it up in a clean place, carry various kinds of flowers, incense, perfumes, flower garlands, jeweled banners, and banners, and make offerings to it, the four heavenly kings, their retinues, and a hundred thousand koṭīnaya gods would all come to him.

source_sentence: 若此經卷流行之處，若復有人誦持此經，以得聞彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來名號，及本昔所發殊勝大願故，當知是處無復橫死，亦復不為諸鬼所持奪其魂魄，設已奪者，還復如故。」
translation: If someone recites and memorizes this sūtra wherever it's popular because they've heard the name of the Bhagavān, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata, and because of the great vow they made in the past, they should know that this place will never again be a place of unintentional death, and they won't be taken away by ghosts that snatch their souls, or if they've been taken away, they'll return as before."

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是，如是！
translation: The Buddha said, "So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 曼殊室利！
translation: Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如汝所說。
translation: Just as you said.

source_sentence: 曼殊室利！
translation: Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 信心善男子、善女人，若欲供養彼如來者，此人應作如來形像，七日七夜受八分齋食清淨食，於清淨處散種種華，燒種種香，以種種繒綵，種種幡幢，莊嚴其處，澡浴清潔，著新淨衣，應生無垢濁心，無怒害心，於一切眾生起利益心，慈悲喜捨平等之心，鼓樂歌讚，右遶佛像，應念彼如來本昔大願并解釋此經，如所思念，如所願求，一切所欲，皆得圓滿——求長壽得長壽，求福報得福報，求自在得自在，求男女得男女。
translation: 信心善男子、善女人，若欲供養彼如來者，此人應作如來形像，七日七夜受八分齋食清淨食，於清淨處散種種華，燒種種香，以種種繒綵，種種幡幢，莊嚴其處，澡浴清潔，著新淨衣，應生無垢濁心，無怒害心，於一切眾生起利益心，慈悲喜捨平等之心，鼓樂歌讚，右遶佛像，應念彼如來本昔大願并解釋此經，如所思念，如所願求，一切所欲，皆得圓滿——求長壽得長壽，求福報得福報，求自在得自在，求男女得男女。

source_sentence: 「或復有人忽得惡夢，或見諸惡相，或怪鳥來集，於其住所百怪出現，此人若能以種種眾具，供養恭敬彼藥師琉璃光如來者，一切惡夢、惡相、不吉祥事皆悉隱沒，或有水怖、火怖、刀怖、毒怖、懸嶮之怖，惡象、師子、虎狼、熊羆、毒蛇、惡蝎、蜈蚣、蚰蜒如是等怖，憶念供養彼如來者，一切怖畏皆得解脫。
translation: "Suppose a person suddenly has a bad dream, sees bad appearances, or sees strange birds coming together, or a hundred strange things appearing in their dwelling, and that person can make offerings of various things to the Tathāgata Yakushi Lapis Light with respect to him, all bad dreams, bad appearances, and inauspicious events will be completely extinguished, and he might have fears of water, fire, swords, poison, dangers, dangerous fears, fears of dangerous elephants, lions, tigers, wolves, bears, vipers, scorpions, centipedes, centipedes, or centipedes, and so forth, and he'll be freed from all fears when he remembers and makes offerings to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 若他國侵擾、賊盜反亂、如是等怖，亦應念彼如來恭敬尊重。
translation: If another country is invaded by them, or if thieves and pirates rebel against them, such fears should also be remembered with respect and veneration for the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 「復次，曼殊室利！
translation: "Furthermore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若有信心善男子、善女人，乃至盡形受三歸依，不事餘天，或持五戒，或持十戒，或持菩薩一百四戒，或復出家受持比丘二百五十戒，若比丘尼受持五百戒，於隨所受中，毀犯禁戒，畏墮惡道，若能供養彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來者，決定不受三惡道報。
translation: "If there are faithful good sons and good women who accept the three refugee bonds up to the end of their lives and don't serve other gods, or if they observe the five precepts, or the ten precepts, or the 144 bodhisattva precepts, or if they leave home and observe the 250 monk precepts, or if they observe the 500 monk nuns precepts, and if they violate the prohibitions and fear falling into a bad path while following their ordination, then if they can make offerings to the Bhagavān, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata, they surely won't be subject to the consequences of the three bad destinies.

source_sentence: 或有女人臨當產時，受於極苦，若能稱名供養彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來者，速得解脫，所生之子身分具足，形色端正，見者歡喜，利根聰明，安隱少病，無有非人奪其魂魄。」
translation: Perhaps there's a woman who's about to give birth and undergoes extreme suffering, but if she can name and make offerings to the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata of Lapis Light, she'll quickly be liberated, and the child she bears will be complete in stature, correct in appearance, pleasing to those who see him, intelligent in his faculties, peaceful, and less prone to illness, and no one will snatch his soul."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告慧命阿難言：「阿難！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Ānanda with wisdom, saying, "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如我稱揚彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來所有功德，汝信受耶？
translation: Do you believe in the merits of the Bhagavān, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata, as I've described them?

source_sentence: 汝於如是諸佛如來甚深境界多生疑惑。」
translation: Do you have many doubts about the profound state of such buddhas and tathāgatas?"

source_sentence: 時，慧命阿難白佛言：「大德世尊！
translation: Wisdom Life Ānanda then said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於如來所說法中，無復疑惑。
translation: I have no more doubts about what the Tathāgata teaches about the Dharma.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 一切如來身口意行無不清淨。
translation: "The physical, verbal, and mental conduct of all tathāgatas is not impure.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此日月，有如是大神通，有如是大威力，可令墮落，須彌山王可得移動，諸佛所言無有差異。
translation: "This sun and moon have such great supernormal powers and such great authority that they can cause a fall, and Mount Sumeru the king of mountains can be moved, with no difference between what the buddhas say.

source_sentence: 大德世尊！
translation: Venerable Śrī Siṃha!

source_sentence: 或有眾生信根不具，聞說如來佛境界已，作是思惟：『云何但念彼如來名獲爾許功德？』
translation: Perhaps there are sentient beings whose faculty of faith is not fully developed who, after hearing about the Tathāgata's buddha-realm, think, 'How can I attain such-and-such merit simply by recollecting the Tathāgata's name?'

source_sentence: 心不信受，生於誹謗，此等長夜無義饒益，當墮苦趣。」
translation: Their minds don't believe in reception, and they give rise to slander; these long nights will bring no meaningful benefit, and they'll fall into the destiny of suffering."

source_sentence: 佛言：「阿難！
translation: The Buddha said, "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若彼如來所有名號入其耳中，此人墮惡道者，無有是處。
translation: If the Tathāgata's name enters his ear, there's no place for that person to fall into a bad path.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 諸佛境界誠為難信，汝今信受，應知皆是如來威力，非一切聲聞、辟支佛地所能信受，唯除一生補處菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: The buddha-realms are truly difficult to believe, so now you should know that you believe in them because of the Tathāgata's power, which cannot be believed by all śrāvakas and solitary realms, except for the bodhisattva-mahāsattva in the patchwork of a lifetime.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 人身難得，於三寶中信敬尊重亦難可得，聞彼如來名號倍難於此。
translation: A human body is difficult to obtain, and faithful reverence for the Three Treasures is also difficult to obtain, so hearing the Tathāgata's name is doubly difficult for that.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來無量菩薩行，無量諸巧便，無量曠大願，我欲一劫若過一劫說彼如來菩薩行願，乃至窮劫，彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來本昔所行及殊勝大願，亦不究盡。」
translation: The Bhagavān, the Tathāgata of Lapis Light, has measureless bodhisattva practices, measureless skillful means, and measureless and vast vows, and I would like to recount the bodhisattva practices and vows of that Bhagavān, the Tathāgata of Lapis Light, for one eon or more, even if it takes an entire eon, and I don't want to exhaust what the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata of Lapis Light, has done in the past and the extraordinary great vows."

source_sentence: 爾時，眾中有菩薩摩訶薩名曰救脫，即從座起，偏露一髆，右膝著地，向婆伽婆合掌曲躬白言：「大德世尊！
translation: At the time, a bodhisattva named Deliverance rose from his seat, bared one shoulder blade, knelt on his right knee, bowed with his palms together to Bhagavān, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於未來世，當有眾生，身嬰重病，長患羸瘦，不食飢渴，喉脣乾燥，死相現前，目無所見，父母、親眷、朋友、知識啼泣圍遶，其人屍形臥在本處，閻摩使人引其神識，置於閻摩法王之前，此人背後有同生神，隨其所作，若罪若福一切皆書，盡持授與閻摩法王。
translation: In a future life, there will be a sentient being who's gravely ill, has a long history of weakness, lacks food and thirst, has a dry throat and lips, and has visible signs of death; their eyes are blank; they're surrounded by their parents, relatives, friends, and friends who weep; and their corpse form is lying in its original place.

source_sentence: 時閻摩法王推問其人，算計所作，隨善隨惡而處分之。
translation: Then, King Yama conjectured about that person, reckoned what he did, and disposed of it according to what was good and what was bad.

source_sentence: 若能為此病人歸依彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來，如法供養，即得還復。
translation: If he could rely on the Bhagavān, the Medicine Buddha, Lapis Light Tathāgata, and make offerings according to the teachings, he would be restored.

source_sentence: 此人神識得迴還時，如從夢覺皆自憶知，或經七日、或二十一日、或三十五日、或四十九日，神識還已，具憶所有善惡業報，由自證故，乃至失命不造惡業。
translation: When this person's consciousness returns, he recollects it on his own, as if from a dream or awakening, whether it's been seven, 21, 35, or 49 days, and then after his consciousness returns, he fully recollects the results of good and bad actions, and because of this self-realization, he doesn't create bad actions even after losing his life.

source_sentence: 是故信心善男子、善女人，應當供養藥師如來。」
translation: Therefore, faithful men and good women should make offerings to the Medicine Tathāgata."

source_sentence: 爾時，慧命阿難問救脫菩薩言：「善男子！
translation: At that point, Wisdom Life Ānanda asked the Deliverance Bodhisattva, "Good man!

source_sentence: 應云何供養彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來也？」
translation: How should I make offerings to the Bhagavān, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata?"

source_sentence: 救脫菩薩言：「大德阿難！
translation: The Bodhisattva of Deliverance said, "Mañjuśrī Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若有患人欲脫重病，當為此人七日七夜受八分齋，當以飲食，及種種眾具，隨力所辦，供養比丘僧，晝夜六時，禮拜供養彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來，四十九遍讀誦此經，然四十九燈，應造七軀彼如來像，一一像前各置七燈，一一燈量大如車輪，或復乃至四十九日光明不絕，當造五色綵幡長四十九尺。
translation: If there's an afflicted person who wants to be freed from a serious illness, you must observe the eight-part purification for that person for seven days and nights, provide food and drink and various necessities as you are able, make offerings to the monks and nuns, venerate and worship the Bhagavān, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata, during the six hours of the day and night, recite this sūtra 49 times, and then build seven images of the Tathāgata out of the 49 lamps, each with seven lamps in front of it, each with a size as large as a chariot wheel, or even forty-nine days of uninterrupted light, and build a five-colored banner 49 feet long.

source_sentence: 「復次，大德阿難！
translation: "Furthermore, Venerable Ānanda!

source_sentence: 灌頂剎利王等，若災難起時——所謂人民疾疫難、他方侵逼難、自界反逆難、星宿變怪難、日月薄蝕難、非時風雨難、過時不雨難——爾時，此灌頂剎利王，當於一切眾生，起慈愍心，赦諸繫閉，依前所說供養法式，供養彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來。
translation: "When calamities arise, such as the people's illness and epidemic, opposition from other directions, disagreement with their own realms, strange constellations, the erosion of the sun and moon, unseasonable winds and rains, or passing periods of drought, the consecrated bhadra king will become compassionate toward all sentient beings, pardon their fetters, and make offerings to the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata of Lapis Light, according to the previously explained ritual for making offerings.

source_sentence: 時灌頂剎利王用此善根，由彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來本昔勝願故，其王境界即得安隱，風雨以時、禾稼成就、國土豐熟，一切國界所有眾生，無病安樂，多生歡喜，於其國界亦無夜叉、羅剎、毘舍闍等諸惡鬼神擾亂眾生，所有惡相皆即不現，彼灌頂剎利王，壽命色力無病自在並得增益。」
translation: As a result of the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata of Lapis Light, the World Honored Medicine Buddha, using this good root, the king's situation becomes peaceful, the winds and rains come in season, crops are produced, the land is abundant, all the sentient beings in his realm are disease-free and happy, and there are no yakṣas, rājas, piśācīs, or other bad spirits in his realm to disturb sentient beings, or to prevent all bad appearances, and that Bhagavān, the king of the bodhisattvas, has longevity, form, strength, freedom from illness, and prosperity."

source_sentence: 爾時，慧命阿難問救脫菩薩言：「善男子！
translation: It was then that Wisdom Life Ānanda asked the Bodhisattva of Deliverance, "Good man!

source_sentence: 云何已盡之命而可更延？」
translation: How can a life that has already ended be prolonged?"

source_sentence: 救脫菩薩言：「阿難！
translation: The Bodhisattva of Deliverance said, "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝豈不聞如來所說九橫死耶？
translation: Have you not heard the Tathāgata speak of nine kinds of irregular death?

source_sentence: 是故教以呪藥方便；或有眾生，得病非重，然無醫藥及看病人，或復醫人療治失所，非時而死，是為初橫；第二橫者，王法所殺；第三橫者，遊獵、放逸、婬醉無度，為諸非人害其魂魄；第四橫者，為火所燒；第五橫者，為水所溺；第六橫者，入師子、虎豹、諸惡獸中；第七橫者，飢渴所困，不得飲食，因此致死；第八橫者，厭禱、毒藥、起屍鬼等之所損害；第九橫者，投巖取死，是名如來略說大橫有此九種，其餘復有無量諸橫。」
translation: 是故教以呪藥方便；或有眾生，得病非重，然無醫藥及看病人，或復醫人療治失所，非時而死，是為初橫；第二橫者，王法所殺；第三橫者，遊獵、放逸、婬醉無度，為諸非人害其魂魄；第四橫者，為火所燒；第五橫者，為水所溺；第六橫者，入師子、虎豹、諸惡獸中；第七橫者，飢渴所困，不得飲食，因此致死；第八橫者，厭禱、毒藥、起屍鬼等之所損害；第九橫者，投巖取死，是名如來略說大橫有此九種，其餘復有無量諸橫。」

source_sentence: 爾時，眾中有十二夜叉大將，俱在會坐，所謂：　宮毘羅大將、　　跋折羅大將、　迷佉羅大將、　　安捺羅大將、　安怛羅大將、　　摩涅羅大將、　因陀羅大將、　　波異羅大將、　摩呼羅大將、　　真達羅大將、　招度羅大將、　　鼻羯羅大將，此等十二夜叉大將，一一各有七千夜叉以為眷屬，皆同一聲白世尊言：「我等今者蒙佛威力，得聞世尊藥師琉璃光如來名號已，不復更有惡道之怖。
translation: At the time, there were twelve great generals of nightjars sitting in the assembly, namely, the generals Kumbhīra, Vajra, Mikkala, Anjara, Antara, Manjara, Indra, Pāyiras, Mahoras, Jandhāra, Khoturā, and Vikrā, and each of these twelve great generals of nightjars had 7,000 nightjars as their followers, and they all said with one voice to the Bhagavān, "Now, thanks to the Buddha's authority, we've heard the name of the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata of Lapis Light, and we no longer have the fear of a bad destiny.

source_sentence: 我今相與皆同一心，乃至壽盡歸依佛、歸依法、歸依僧，皆當荷負一切眾生，為作義利，饒益安樂，隨於何等村城聚落阿蘭拏處，若流布此經，若復持彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來名號親近供養者，我等眷屬衛護是人，皆使解脫一切苦難，諸有所求，悉令滿足。」
translation: Now, we are all of the same mind, and even when our lives are up, we will take refuge in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the saṃgha, and we will bear the burden of all sentient beings, work for their benefit and welfare, and disseminate this sūtra in whatever village or town or colony or araṇya, and if we also bear the name of the Bhagavān, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata, and make offerings to him, our retinue will guard him, free him from all suffering and difficulties, and we will fulfill all his requests."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊讚諸夜叉大將言：「善哉，善哉！
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān praised the great generals of the night-sharks, saying, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 大夜叉將！
translation: Great Yakṣa General!

source_sentence: 汝等若念彼世尊藥師琉璃光如來恩德者，當念饒益一切眾生。」
translation: If you remember the merits of that Bhagavān, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata, you should remember to bring benefit to all sentient beings."

source_sentence: 爾時，慧命阿難白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Wisdom Life Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此經何名？
translation: What is the name of this scripture?

source_sentence: 云何奉持？」
translation: How do you uphold it?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「阿難！
translation: The Buddha said, "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 此法門者，名為『藥師琉璃光如來本昔所發殊勝大願』，當如是持；名為『十二夜叉大將自誓』，當如是持；名為『淨一切業障』，當如是持。」
translation: This is a teaching that is called 'the excellent great vow originally made by the Healing Buddha, the Lapis Lazuli Radiance Tathāgata,' which should be thus maintained; 'the vow of the twelve great generals of the night-sharks,' which should be thus maintained; and 'the purification of all karmic hindrances,' which should be thus maintained."

source_sentence: 時婆伽婆說是語已，諸菩薩摩訶薩、諸大聲聞、國王、大臣、婆羅門、居士，及一切大眾阿修羅、揵達婆等，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Bhagavān spoke these words, the bodhisattvas, great śrāvakas, kings, ministers, priests, householders, and all the masses of asuras and gandharvas who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 佛說藥師如來本願經
translation: Foshuo yakṣa tathāgata benyuan jing
